name: Centre for Information Policy Leadership at Hunton Andrews Kurth LLP
memberOrga: A listing of our corporate and organisational members and project participants can be found on our website here: https://www.informationpolicycentre.com/membership.htm
goal: The Centre for Information Policy Leadership (CIPL) is a global data privacy and cybersecurity think tank located in the law firm of Hunton Andrews Kurth. CIPLâ€™s mission is to engage in thought leadership and develop best practices that ensure both effective privacy protections and the responsible use of personal information in the modern information age.
interests: Banking and financial services, Borders and Security, Business and Industry, Communication, Competition, Consumers, Culture, Culture and media, Digital economy and society, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, External Relations, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Youth
euInitiatives: The EU areas of interest are related to those areas of legislation (directives and regulations) that impact privacy 	professionals, organisations and consumers such as GDPR, ePrivacy Directive, Accountability and Artificial Intelligence.
